title: Using the App in the Field
text: Navigate the interface, capture data, attach photos, and use GPS tracking effectively.

title: Using the App in the Field
text:
App Interface Overview

Main Screen Elements

Map View: Your primary workspace
Search Bar: Find locations and features
Layers Panel: Manage map layers
Location Button: Center on your position
Menu: Access settings and tools



Navigation Tools

Pan: Drag to move around the map
Zoom: Pinch or use zoom buttons
Rotate: Two-finger rotation gesture
Tilt: Two-finger vertical drag

title: Using the App in the Field
text:
Data Collection

Adding New Features

Tap the “+” button
Select feature type
Position on the map
Fill out the form
Save the feature



Editing Existing Features

Tap on a feature
Select “Edit”
Modify geometry or attributes
Save changes

title: Using the App in the Field
text:
Photo Attachments

Taking Photos

Open a feature’s form
Tap the camera icon
Take or select photos
Add captions if needed



Photo Requeriments

Take photo of willow leave
Take photo of willow flowwer/catkin
Take photo of willow area (to verify density)



Photo Best Practices

Good lightining
Do not upload blurred photos, you can hold the plant if needed
Keep file sizes reasonable

title: Using the App in the Field
text:
GPS and Location

Location Accuracy

Wait for GPS lock before collecting data
Check accuracy indicators
Use external GPS for higher precision
Consider environmental factors



Tracking

Enable location tracking
Set tracking intervals
Monitor battery usage
Review tracks regularly

title: Using the App in the Field
text:
Working Offline

Downloading Maps

Open the map
Tap “Download”
Select area and detail level
Wait for download completion



Offline Data Collection

All features work offline
Photos are stored locally
Forms function normally
Sync when connection returns

title: Using the App in the Field
text:
Quality Control

Data Validation

Review forms before saving
Check coordinate accuracy
Verify photo attachments
Use validation rules



Error Handling

Address form validation errors
Check for duplicate features
Resolve sync conflicts
Maintain data integrity

title: Using the App in the Field
text:
Next Steps
Learn about:

Syncing your collected data
Best practices for field work
Advanced techniques

title: Syncing and Managing Data
text: Sync collected data back to ArcGIS Online and access it for analysis and reporting.

title: Syncing and Managing Data
text:
Understanding Sync

What Gets Synced

New features and edits
Photo attachments
Attribute updates
Deleted features
Location tracks



Sync Requirements

Internet connection
Valid ArcGIS credentials
Sufficient storage space
Compatible data formats

title: Syncing and Managing Data
text:
Manual Sync

Initiating Sync

Open the map
Tap the sync button
Wait for completion
Check for errors



Sync Status

Green: Successful sync
Yellow: Partial sync with warnings
Red: Sync failed
Blue: Sync in progress

title: Syncing and Managing Data
text:
Automatic Sync

Enabling Auto-Sync

Access app settings
Enable automatic sync
Set sync intervals
Configure sync conditions



Sync Triggers

Time-based intervals
WiFi connection available
Battery level thresholds
Data volume limits

title: Syncing and Managing Data
text:
Conflict Resolution

Types of Conflicts

Attribute conflicts: Same feature edited by multiple users
Geometry conflicts: Feature location changed
Delete conflicts: Feature deleted by another user



Resolution Strategies

Review conflict details
Choose appropriate version
Merge changes when possible
Document resolution decisions

title: Syncing and Managing Data
text:
Data Management

Viewing Synced Data

Access ArcGIS Online
Open your web map
View feature layers
Check attribute tables



Data Analysis

Use ArcGIS Online analysis tools
Export to other formats
Create reports and dashboards
Share with stakeholders

title: Syncing and Managing Data
text:
Troubleshooting

Common Sync Issues

Network connectivity: Check internet connection
Storage space: Free up device storage
Permissions: Verify layer edit permissions
Data size: Large attachments may fail



Error Messages

“Sync failed”: Check network and retry
“Insufficient permissions”: Contact administrator
“Storage full”: Clear space and retry
“Invalid data”: Check form validation

title: Syncing and Managing Data
text:
Best Practices

Sync Frequency

Sync regularly to avoid data loss
Use WiFi for large uploads
Monitor data usage on cellular
Backup important data



Data Quality

Review data before syncing
Validate coordinates and attributes
Check photo quality and relevance
Remove unnecessary features

title: Syncing and Managing Data
text:
Next Steps
Explore advanced topics:

Tips and best practices
Troubleshooting common issues
Advanced workflows

title: ArcGIS Field Maps Tutorial - Complete Beginner’s Guide
text:
A comprehensive, beginner-friendly tutorial for field data collection using ArcGIS Field Maps. Learn everything from installation to advanced data management techniques.
Start Learning

title: ArcGIS Field Maps Tutorial - Complete Beginner’s Guide
text:
Tutorial Sections

Everything you need to know
From basic installation to advanced field workflows, this tutorial covers all aspects of ArcGIS Field Maps.



Getting Started
Learn how to install the app and set up your ArcGIS account for field data collection.
Learn More


Preparing a Map
Configure web maps in ArcGIS Online, add editable layers, and set up offline areas.
Learn More


Using the App in the Field
Navigate the interface, capture data, attach photos, and use GPS tracking effectively.
Learn More


Syncing and Managing Data
Sync collected data back to ArcGIS Online and access it for analysis and reporting.
Learn More

title: ArcGIS Field Maps Tutorial - Complete Beginner’s Guide
text:
Best Practices

Tips for Success



Offline Workflows
Learn how to work efficiently without internet connectivity


Battery Management
Optimize your device settings for extended field work

title: Getting Started
text: Learn how to install the app and set up your ArcGIS account for field data collection.

title: Getting Started
text:
Installation

Mobile App Installation

iOS Devices: Download from the App Store
Android Devices: Download from Google Play Store
Windows Devices: Download from Microsoft Store



System Requirements

iOS 13.0 or later
Android 7.0 (API level 24) or later
Windows 10 version 17763.0 or later

title: Getting Started
text: Account Setup

title: Getting Started
text:
First Login

Open the Field Maps app
Sign In with ArcGIS Online
Your ArcGIS organization’s URL: uib.maps.arcgis.com
Sign in with your university account (email + password)

title: Getting Started
text:
Next Steps
Once you’re logged in, you’re ready to:

On “Maps” search for “willow_mapping_finse_field2”
There is a file called “willow_mapping_finse”, however it is from the first fieldwork. DO NOT use it.

title: Preparing a Map
text: Configure web maps in ArcGIS Online, add editable layers, and set up offline areas.

title: Preparing a Map
text:
Creating a Web Map

Step 1: Access ArcGIS Online

Sign in to ArcGIS Online
Navigate to the Map Viewer
Click “Create New Map”



Step 2: Add Base Layers

Choose an appropriate basemap
Consider offline availability
Select imagery or topographic maps as needed

title: Preparing a Map
text:
Adding Editable Layers

Feature Layers

Click “Add Layer” → “Create Feature Layer”
Define your feature types (points, lines, polygons)
Configure attribute fields
Set up domains and constraints



Form Configuration

Access the layer’s settings
Configure the data collection form
Set field types and validation rules
Add conditional logic if needed

title: Preparing a Map
text:
Offline Settings

Enabling Offline Use

Open map settings
Enable “Offline” capability
Set sync options
Configure attachment settings



Download Areas

Define offline areas
Set appropriate scale levels
Consider file size limitations
Test download performance

title: Preparing a Map
text:
Sharing Your Map

Setting Permissions

Save your web map
Configure sharing settings
Share with your organization or groups
Set appropriate access levels



Field Maps Configuration

Enable Field Maps in map settings
Configure location tracking
Set up data collection workflows
Test with the mobile app

title: Preparing a Map
text:
Best Practices

Keep forms simple and intuitive
Use appropriate field types
Test offline functionality
Optimize for mobile devices
Consider data storage limits

title: Preparing a Map
text:
Next Steps
With your map prepared, you’re ready to:

Use the app in the field
Learn about data syncing
Explore best practices

title: Tips & Best Practices
text:
Download maps before heading to the field
Test offline functionality in the office
Prepare backup power sources
Plan data collection routes efficiently





Use appropriate map scales
Limit offline area size
Choose efficient basemaps
Monitor storage usage





Sync regularly when connection is available
Keep local storage organized
Backup critical data
Monitor sync status

title: Tips & Best Practices
text:
Download maps before heading to the field
Test offline functionality in the office
Prepare backup power sources
Plan data collection routes efficiently





Use appropriate map scales
Limit offline area size
Choose efficient basemaps
Monitor storage usage





Sync regularly when connection is available
Keep local storage organized
Backup critical data
Monitor sync status

title: Tips & Best Practices
text:
Battery Management

Device Settings

Reduce screen brightness
Disable unnecessary apps
Use airplane mode in poor signal areas
Enable power saving modes



External Power

Carry portable battery packs
Use vehicle charging when available
Consider solar charging options
Plan charging schedules



App Optimization

Close unused apps
Disable location services for other apps
Use offline maps to reduce data usage
Minimize photo resolution when appropriate

title: Tips & Best Practices
text:
Troubleshooting

Common Issues

GPS accuracy problems

Wait for better satellite lock
Move to open areas
Check device settings
Consider external GPS

Sync failures

Check internet connection
Verify credentials
Clear app cache
Contact support

App crashes

Restart the app
Update to latest version
Clear device storage
Report bugs

title: Tips & Best Practices
text:
Getting Help

Resources
